labels.analysis: The StatPearls Medical Knowledge Server provides access to reliable, peer-reviewed medical information, formatted in a way that can be easily interpreted by AI systems. Its primary tool allows users to search and retrieve comprehensive data about diseases and conditions. This server serves as a knowledge base for medical information, enabling AI to enhance conversations with accurate and trusted medical knowledge seamlessly integrated via the Model Context Protocol.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of this server is to provide medical knowledge, which aligns best with the Education category, as it is a source of accurate educational content for medical professionals or learners. The secondary label of Memory Management is appropriate because it acts as a repository of medical information. The server does not fit neatly into predefined categories beyond these, so no custom label is necessary.

server_info_crawled.name: StatPearls Medical Knowledge Server
server_info_crawled.author: @jpoles1/statpearls-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide your AI system with reliable, peer-reviewed medical information about diseases and conditions. Search and retrieve comprehensive medical content from StatPearls, formatted in AI-friendly Markdown. Enhance your AI conversations with trusted medical knowledge seamlessly integrated via the Model Context Protocol.

tools.name: statpearls_disease_info
tools.description: Deploy Server StatPearls Medical Knowledge Server @jpoles1/statpearls-mcp Try in Playground statpearls_disease_info

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@jpoles1/statpearls-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
